stems: the ball is in your court

def: {bc} a formal legal meeting in which evidence about crimes, disagreements, etc., is presented to a judge and often a jury so that decisions can be made according to the law
{bc} a place where legal cases are heard
{bc} an official group of people (such as a judge and jury) who listen to evidence and make decisions about legal cases

dt: {bc}a formal legal meeting in which evidence about crimes, disagreements, etc., is presented to a judge and often a jury so that decisions can be made according to the law

dt.t: {it}Court{/it} is now in session.
{it}Court{/it} is adjourned for the day.
a {it}court{/it} battle/fight
{it}court{/it} cases/records/costs

dt: {bc}a place where legal cases are heard

dt.t: There was a large group of protesters outside the {it}court{/it}.
a lawyer who has appeared in {it}courts{/it} around the country
His landlord threatened to {phrase}take him to court{/phrase}. [=to start a lawsuit against him; to sue him]
The organization is prepared to {phrase}go to court{/phrase} [=to start a lawsuit] to stop construction from proceeding.
They were able to settle/resolve the case {phrase}out of court{/phrase}. [=without going to court]

dt: {bc}an official group of people (such as a judge and jury) who listen to evidence and make decisions about legal cases

dt.t: The case is before the state's highest {it}court{/it}.
She's a judge on an appellate {it}court{/it}.
state/federal {it}courts{/it}
The prosecution has new evidence to submit to the {it}court{/it}.
Please explain to the {it}court{/it} what happened that night.
The {it}court{/it} ruled/declared the law unconstitutional.
The {it}court{/it} reversed/rejected the lower court's decision.

dt: {bc}a large flat surface that is shaped like a square or rectangle and that is used for playing games like tennis and basketball

dt.t: a basketball/tennis {it}court{/it}

dt: {bc}the place where the leader of a country and especially a king or queen lives and works

dt.t: the {it}courts{/it} of Europe
He spent a lot of time {phrase}at court{/phrase}.

dt: {bc}a king or queen and the people who live and work with him or her

dt.t: The queen assembled her {it}court{/it}.
a member of the king's {it}court{/it}

dt: used in the names of short streets

dt.t: My sister lives on Brynhurst {it}Court{/it}.

dt: used in the names of apartment buildings or groups of apartment buildings

dt.t: I live in the Franklin {it}Court{/it} apartments on Main Street.
the villa's inner {it}court{/it}
an interior {it}court{/it} garden

dt: {bc}to talk to a group of people who listen to what you say because it is funny or interesting

dt.t: The restaurant's owner was {it}holding court{/it} at his usual table in the corner.

dt: {bc}to give a lot of attention to (someone) in order to get approval, affection, etc.

dt.t: He does not approve of the young man who has {it}been paying court to{/it} his daughter. [=who has been courting his daughter]

dros.drp: the ball is in your court

dt: {bc}the beliefs and judgment of most people

dt.t: The statement was quickly condemned in {it}the court of public opinion{/it}. [=was condemned by the public]

shortdef: a formal legal meeting in which evidence about crimes, disagreements, etc., is presented to a judge and often a jury so that decisions can be made according to the law —often used before another noun
a place where legal cases are heard
an official group of people (such as a judge and jury) who listen to evidence and make decisions about legal cases

def: {it}somewhat old-fashioned{/it} {bc} to act in a way that shows that you want or intend to get married
{it}of an animal{/it} {bc} to perform the actions that lead to sexual activity
{bc} to give a lot of attention and praise to (someone) in order to get approval, support, etc.

dt: {bc}to act in a way that shows that you want or intend to get married

dt.t: The couple {it}courted{/it} for two years before marrying.
He was {it}courting{/it} his college sweetheart.

dt: {bc}to perform the actions that lead to sexual activity

dt.t: a pair of robins {it}courting{/it}
The male will sometimes {it}court{/it} the female for hours.

dt: {bc}to give a lot of attention and praise to (someone) in order to get approval, support, etc.

dt.t: college teams {it}courting{/it} high school basketball stars
The government is {it}courting{/it} [={it}wooing{/it}] investors from around the globe.
The speech was clearly intended to {it}court{/it} middle-class voters.

dt: If you {phrase}court someone's favor{/phrase} or {phrase}court favor with someone{/phrase}, you try to get someone's approval.

dt.t: The company is {it}courting favor with{/it} consumers by portraying itself as socially responsible.

dt: {bc}to act in a way that is likely to cause (something unpleasant) to happen to you

dt.t: Anyone who refuses to evacuate is {phrase}courting disaster{/phrase}. [={it}flirting with disaster{/it}]
They knew they were {phrase}courting danger/trouble{/phrase} by accepting donations from a convicted felon.

shortdef: to act in a way that shows that you want or intend to get married
to perform the actions that lead to sexual activity
to give a lot of attention and praise to (someone) in order to get approval, support, etc.

def: {bc} a military court {bc} a court for people in the military who are accused of breaking military law
{bc} a trial in a military court

dt: {bc}a military court {bc}a court for people in the military who are accused of breaking military law

dt.t: The officers will be tried by {it}court-martial{/it}.
They will appear before a {it}court-martial{/it}.
The sergeant is facing a {it}court-martial{/it} for failure to obey orders.

shortdef: a military court : a court for people in the military who are accused of breaking military law
a trial in a military court

def: {bc} to present evidence against (someone) in a military court {bc} to put (someone) on trial in a military court

dt: {bc}to present evidence against (someone) in a military court {bc}to put (someone) on trial in a military court

dt.t: He was {it}court-martialed{/it} for failure to obey orders.

shortdef: to present evidence against (someone) in a military court : to put (someone) on trial in a military court

def: {bc} a court that studies the decisions made by a lower court and decides if they were correct
{b}{it}Court of Appeals{/it}{/b} {it}US{/it} {bc} any one of 13 courts in the U.S. below the Supreme Court
{b}{it}Court of Appeal{/it}{/b} {it}British{/it} {bc} the highest court in Britain below the House of Lords

dt: {bc}a court that studies the decisions made by a lower court and decides if they were correct
{bc}any one of 13 courts in the U.S. below the Supreme Court

dt.t: the 9th/Ninth Circuit {it}Court of Appeals{/it}

dt: {bc}the highest court in Britain below the House of Lords

shortdef: a court that studies the decisions made by a lower court and decides if they were correct —called also (US) appeals court, appeal court
any one of 13 courts in the U.S. below the Supreme Court
the highest court in Britain below the House of Lords

dt.t: You have the right to a fair trial in a {it}court of law{/it}.

def: {bc} a formal statement from a court that orders someone to do or stop doing something

dt: {bc}a formal statement from a court that orders someone to do or stop doing something

dt.t: He received a {it}court order{/it} barring him from entering the building.
He is barred by {it}court order{/it} from entering the building.
The town is under {it}court order{/it} to fix the problem.

shortdef: a formal statement from a court that orders someone to do or stop doing something

def: {bc} a person whose job is to write down exactly what is said and done during a legal trial

dt: {bc}a person whose job is to write down exactly what is said and done during a legal trial

shortdef: a person whose job is to write down exactly what is said and done during a legal trial
